definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: But one storyteller calls it the "Hell's Gate Gang."
sentences.chinese: 但一講故事的人稱之爲“地獄之門崗。”

sentences.english: He rode that mountain lion all the way to the camp of the Hell'sGate Gang.
sentences.chinese: 他騎着那山獅一路到地獄的營地門崗。

sentences.english: The iron gate was closed fast and four policemen stood on guard.
sentences.chinese: 鐵門是關得緊緊的了，兩對警察是門崗。
